intro: Bakeridesia galeottii, commonly known as the Galeotti's spurge, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its smooth, often succulent stems and alternate, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, which are typical of the spurge family. It is native to southern Africa and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Bakeridesia galeottii is often found in rocky soils and can be drought-tolerant, making it adaptable to harsh conditions.
